title: Actually Penalized For Stating Our Comp Was Unviable
body:
I had faith in the system and my right to express an opinion without harassing or insulting others till this happened. However, I guess the system does not understand the difference between valid reports and false reports well enough and considers reports worthy of consideration regardless of merit. 

Our comp. was awful and our players were not working together at all in the game or in the lobby to alleviate the issues. They basically had the attitude of "I don't care... I do what I want and the team can pay for it. Everyone can be thrown under the bus if I have my fun." When I stated my opinion about the comp., I got flamed hard, called autistic, and was met with profanities. I was firmly under the impression that I cannot be punished merely for expressing another point of view and in this case, I don't think it was even really a matter of opinion. Our comp. actually was awful when judged coldly. I'm not here to be a team cheerleader and to promote false delusions. I will be HONEST. As far as I'm concerned, this moves past reducing harassment and bullying straight into thought control. In fact, I was the one actually being bullied here (all chat calls for reports etc.) just because I didn't say everything was sunshine and roses when it clearly was not. It was entirely within our power to never find ourselves in such a situation. The game was just automatically reviewed and I got the penalty seconds after it ended so clearly no human read the log to actually understand anything. The game I'm discussing is game 1.

Here are the glorious chat logs of the worst offenses Riot's bots could find due to reports:

*I apologize for the awful typos but I only typed while moving or dead so I'm not focusing on such things. Also, keep in mind that you have no idea about what I'm actually responding to and nothing is said in a vacuum randomly. The most I see is me vehemently disagreeing with certain team decisions. I'm not just going off on someone out of the blue or even criticizing them personally. It's all about the decisions.

BTW: This happened on a different account ranked Platinum 4 but I'd rather keep it anonymous. My intention here isn't to remove the chat restriction or get anything from anyone. I'm here to highlight a blatant flaw with the system - which is clearly way too reliant on report frequency rather than validity. I don't think any of my games here were that out of line for a heated competition. 

Again, these aren't even the norm. These are the few games Riot could find which triggered reports. Two of which were mostly because I strongly maintained an opinion. The first was because I said our comp. wasn't viable and pretty much autoloses without snowballing. The second was me stating that Ivern is overpowered while someone on my team disagreed with me and basically called me an idiot to suggest Ivern was over the top. The last game was just strong disagreement with some team decisions. I'm not responsible for people's emotional problems and their inability to handle a competitive game with criticism.

replies.body: Sounds like overall severe negativity and some choice words in Game 2, not "because I merely stated our comp was unviable".

> [{quoted}](name=NineTailedMystic,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JEOAcgnt,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-03-10T06:01:06.796+0000)
>
> Sounds like overall severe negativity and some choice words in Game 2, not "because I merely stated our comp was unviable".

There's obvious frustration but it doesn't seem that bad (especially for games supposedly selected for toxicity). I know my behavior could have been better but having room for improvement doesn't mean you actually cross the line into meriting punishments for toxicity. It's also not as if every comment has to be positive or constructive in order for it to not be considered toxic. I don't have to filter everything and I don't recall being paid to become the team cheerleader. I am only myself. My only responsibility as I see it is to not personally attack/harass/insult others and to keep it about the game. We should strive for more but it's just a bonus.

Here's my Riot support message btw:

> With no previous warning, I receive a chat restriction immediately after a game in which I criticized the comp. This was clearly not read by a human but was instead triggered by at least two very vocal players who were calling for reports on me. This is not justified unless I am actually not allowed to express any opinion except what people want to hear. There was no insult, no harassment, no profanity etc.
> 
> The other linked games are similar and mostly about tactical disagreements or opinions on champions (Ivern). I understand that toxicity is a problem but this is not a fair assessment because occassionally disagreeing with someone strongly isn't the same as being toxic. Toxicity is about retaliation, personal attacks, insults etc. not discussing whether Ivern is OP or whether a comp. is viable.
> 
> I don't want vague notions about why I was punished. It's pretty obvious that even if I was near some sort of threshold for punishment, the evidence presented is not valid. I should not get moved from near a threshold to punishment based off false evidence. Likewise, if you were close to the illegal limit of alcohol while driving but then a cop pulls you over and injects you with more alcohol in order to arrest you, that would not be OK. You might have been close to the limit but using false evidence to get you over it is not ethical or logical. The triggering game is a textbook case of false reports at work.

But you were negative (attitude of giving up)  in all the games shown.

For you to be punished with "negativity" (which is a mild form for toxicity), it must happen over loooooootttttttttsssss of games. So ask yourself how often you have an attitude like that, and that is why you got dinged here.

In game1, instead of demoralizing the team and saying "game is lost", you can just say "if we want to win, we have to get 10 kills early", and gameplan towards a win condition instead of giving up.

There is a whole lot more here than just "disagreeing with the team comp", considering how that was only one game of the three presented. The other chat logs show a very negative and rather rude attitude when it came to your teammates, and it obviously shows how you treated your teammates. You act very rude, and instead of just letting something go, you constantly bring it up and up again. If they were the ones who kept bringing it up, than why bother to respond? 

These are not inherently toxic, but if I ever met you in real life, and you talked like that, it doesn't matter if you're stating a correct fact or opinion, I'd brand you off as a jerk, and would rather not be around you. Even if these are not that bad, we have no way of knowing whether or not you consistently act this way, this low brand negativity that drags the game down for everyone else, but considering how you did get a Chat restriction because of this, I'm rather inclined to believe you do act this way. 

Three games aren't the only reason you got Chat restricted, and I'm skeptical to believe that each of your reports were done only by the people flaming you.

Toxic-not quite.  Annoying- yes.  Stating that your comp wont work is one thing- taking 50 lines to do so is another.  Getting the last word in a league argument doesn't really matter.  If you're right you're right, and there's no convincing people otherwise so it's best just to drop it after a while.

I can't believe you find "cancervern" toxic. You've got to be kidding me lmao. You're thick as a brick or trolling. That's not even about the person. "OMG he called my champion cancerous to play against and was happy when they killed me!!! RITO PLZ!!!" What if someone says "delete LB plz" like Riot actually did this patch? That's the same intention as "cancervern" - in other words a person hates playing against that champion. Do you then go on a huge hissy fit and cry to Riot in reports about how X champion was harassed and denied its existence? Let's get real here. There's oversensitivity and then there's insanity.
No way for us to see that. We only get to see the logs.

On one hand if you play off-meta and your team doesn't like it, you get punished for "not communicating" which isn't even a report option. Here "communication" is code for do what's expected of you and what your team wants rather than actually sharing your plan. On the other hand, if you do communicate as here, it's reportable because they disagree with you and don't want your opinion unless it's that they're very special snowflakes. I guess fascism is alive and well, at least in certain video games.

Not communicating at least used to be a report option.  They may have just made it part of one of the current ones.

Anyways I'd say this case is at least a reasonable report for negative attitude, which I think at most applies a chat restriction.  I personally wouldn't report op, but I could understand others doing so at least in the first game.  I didn't read the second, but the third seemed fine to me personally.
Why is every little thing that irritates people "toxic" now?

Cultured sensitivity. 

We've created a cyber culture which promotes punishment for anything that upsets us in a game.  This has sensitized us to the things that upset us, normalized punishment, and resulted in a community which reports everything, and is sensitive to even the most gentle language.

How amazing is it that we are so desensitized towards violence from watching it on T.V., yet so sensitive about *words* from being told to be, by the media, our teachers, and bad parenting.

Don't bully, don't say mean words, stay in your safe space, and please, give everyone trigger warnings.

What do MIAs have to do with a teammate's pick? How can you possibly suggest that those things were related? This wasn't even about a teammate not respecting MIAs. It was about a lack of MIAs. Stop roleplaying when Riot refuses to give context. The rest is similarly misinformed (saying I gave up for example) and yes, that game was compositionally lost. That's REALITY. Accusing someone of "negative attitude" for stating reality is silly. Also, they definitely DID NOT have a real desire to win if they picked in such a way since there was massive antisynergy and even the most basic aspects of a comp. were not met. It wasn't hard for the enemy team to hard counter them either. This was discussed in champ. select but no one cared. The team's actions support that assertion. It's not out of the blue.

These are not my standard chat logs but I don't think they merit any punishment. To me, that shows more an issue with the system and overly sensitive people who cannot handle any opinions besides positive and encouraging (regardless of what is logical or true). If I complain about Ivern, rightfully so as even the statistics show, that's not "negative attitude". That's just questioning game balance and offering support for your opinion. It's not even a slight on the team.

Negative attitude is when you are very negative for NO REASON and with DISREGARD TO REALITY. For example, if it's a sunny day and you say that today seems terrible over and over, that would be negative attitude. If on the other hand, it's a blizzard and people's property is being destroyed, that statement becomes reality for the traditional definition of "terrible." It is NOT negative attitude because it's just reflecting reality. Just because the statement might make someone feel the same, doesn't mean it is the same. However, it seems many are incapable or unwilling to understand this distinction. Likewise, if it's 2-25 with no turrets and inhibitors, the person saying "let's ff we're not winning this" isn't being negative. This is just the ACTUAL SITUATION you're in. The same goes if you went a full early game comp. and find yourself floundering at 40 minutes. Pointing that out isn't a matter of attitude as much as just how the game works. If you were struggling but had a late game comp. at 40 minutes, similar comments would be negative attitude since the onus is on the enemy team to prove a win before they get outscaled. Your chances may be decent even if you're very behind.

With how vague and arbitrary the ToS is as well as how it seems people report purely off emotion, this whole system should probably be thrown in the garbage. It is not ethical or fair. It's only based off what people feel and everything is left to interpretation.
